description.narrative: Capacities of subnational institutions are enhanced for child-sensitive and participatory social policy planning to support vulnerable girls and boys., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Economic And Social Policy General, Public Finance And Local Governance, Reducing Child Poverty, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, child poverty and well-being are regularly monitored, and social policies, especially social protection systems, are strengthened to favour the social inclusion of vulnerable girls and boys at the national and decentralized levels.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Capacities of subnational institutions are enhanced for child-sensitive and participatory social policy planning to supportvulnerable girls and boys.

description.narrative: Based on high level dialogue with Ministry of interior (General Directorate of Territorial Collectivities (DGCT)) a partnership framework (concept note for decentralized programme) was developed aiming at strengthening the territorial convergence and child sensitive local planning in collaboration with both elected institutions and sectoral actors at decentralized levels. Furthermore, three priority regions has been selected by the office for the next Country Programme based human development indicators and children&39;s access to basic social services. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:14/01/2022
